title: Humanized Learning Design Course for University Instructors

context.prior_knowledge: University-level teaching experience or foundational knowledge of instructional design
context.additional_context: A competency enhancement program for designing language education courses in a smartphone-centric, limited-technology environment for learners composed of working professionals

learning_goals: Learners can describe a humanized instructional design framework for language education in three stages (planning-execution-reflection) within six months.
Learners can create a non-real-time LMS activity design document reflecting the five core principles of care pedagogy (empathy, relationship, participation, flexibility, reflection).
Learners can develop three or more iterative design prototypes based on learner data analysis for continuous improvement.
Learners can collaboratively develop and present a language education curriculum design aligned with project-based assessment criteria.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
